clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of a Cognitive and Physical Intervention to Reduce Head and Muscle Pain in a Large Population
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of a Cognitive and Physical Intervention to Reduce Head and Muscle Pain in a Population of an Extensive Territory

brief_summary.textblock: This study is an interventional trial to evaluate the effectiveness of a cognitive and physical program (Intervention), in reducing the frequency of head and neck pain in the population of an extensive territory of Italy.

detailed_description.textblock:
In a previous non-randomized-controlled study in which the cognitive and physical programme was applied to a consistent number of office workers, a significant reduction of frequency of pain in the head and neck areas and of analgesic drug consumption was obtained. The results were stable at a 12 month follow up. More recently a controlled, cluster randomised, interventional trial was conducted on 1930 local government employees of the Municipality of Turin. The data obtained confirm those of the previous studies.
The present study was designed to confirm the data in a much more extensive population , that is, residents of the Italian Region Piemonte (Piedmont) who will apply to participate.
Primary objective is to confirm the effectiveness of the cognitive and physical programme (Intervention), in reducing the frequency of pain involving the head and neck area in a large population of a territory.
Secondary objective is to confirm the effectiveness of the Intervention, in reducing analgesic drugs consumption after the Intervention in the same population.

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in number of days per month with headache and shoulders pain after 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction in number of days per month of drug intake after 12 months

arm_group.description: Experimental: Cognitive and physical program. Non randomized residents in the territory of Piedmont (Piemonte) Italy.

intervention.description: Behavioral: Cognitive, Relaxation, Exercise Therapy The intervention consists of brief shoulder and neck exercises to be performed several times a day, a relaxation exercise and instructions of how to reduce hyperfunction of the craniofacial and cervical muscles during the day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All residents of the Region Piemonte (Italy) may apply for recruitment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Because of the pragmatic design, no exclusion criteria are required for this study
